Class HighScores

java.lang.Object
  HighScores

public class HighScores
extends Object

This sorts and outputs the top 10 highest game scores and according usernames into a file.

Version:
4, June 6 2014.
Author:
Sabrina Cancelliere

          (String) Stores the name of the highscores file.

          (String) Stores the user's current level.

          (int) Stores the user's latest score.
(package private)  int[] scores
          (String array) Stores the top ten highscores as well as the most recent score for processing.

Constructor Detail

HighScores

public HighScores(int score,
                  String username,
                  String level)
This method is a constructor of HighScores, which sets the values of score, username and level. The if structure controls the execution of the class based on the boolean returned by readFile.

Parameters:
score - (int) Sends in the latest score.
username - (String) Sends in the latest username.
level - (String) Sends in the current level

HighScores

                  String[] usernames)
This method is the second constructor of HighScores, which accepts two string arrays. The if structure controls the execution of the class based on the boolean returned by readFile.

Parameters:
usernames - (String array) Stores the top ten usernames.
tempStr - (String array) Stores the top ten high scores.
Method Detail

readFile

public boolean readFile(String[] tempStr,
                        String[] usernames)
This method checks the validity of the highscores file and reads in its contents, otherwise it creates a new one. The first for loop is used to read in the information from the highscores file while sorting it into arrays. The first if structure checks to make sure the file being read starts with the correct "Sabrina and Xin Hao" and has the proper file extension. The next if statement is used to sort the data being read from the file into the correct array (Username and level in one array, scores in the next). The first try catch catches any exceptions when reading from the file. The next catch catches any NullPointerExceptions.

Parameters:
tempStr - (String array) Where to temporarily store scores.
usernames - (String) Where to store usernames.
input - (reference) References the BufferedReader class to read from the highscores file.
x - (int) Used in the for loops.
e - (reference) Type of exception that occured.
Throws:
IOException - If there is a problem reading from the file.
NullPointerException - If the program attempts to sue a null variable in the place of an actual value.

sortScores

public void sortScores()
This method is used to sort the new score into the top ten scores. The first for loop is used to parse the integers read in from the file and store them in the scores array. The second and third nested for loops are used to sort the top ten scores read from the files and the new added score. The try catch catches any exceptions when parsing the ints from the tempStr array.

Parameters:
j - (int) Used to sort the top ten scores.
i - (int) Used to sort the top ten scores.
key - (int) Used to sort the top ten scores.
nameKey - (String) Used to sort the top ten usernames and according levels.
e - (reference) Used in the try catches.

printToFile

public void printToFile(int[] scores,
                        String[] usernames)
This method is used to print the top ten scores and according usernames and levels into the highscores file. The for loop is used to read the top ten scores and according information into the highscores file. The first and second if structures check whether the data being read in is either null or zero and outputs "--" instead of the actual value in that case. The try catch catches any exceptions when writing to the highscores file.

Parameters:
scores - (int array) The scores to print.
usernames - (String array) The usernames and levels to print.
output - (reference) References the PrintWriter class to allow data to be written into the highscores file.
x - (int) Used in the for loop.
e - (reference) Used in the try catches.
Throws:
IOExceptions - If an error occurs writing to the file.
